duties_responsibilities.duty: Maintain and repair conveyance, automation, and facilities equipment to support operations uptime and improve reliability of systems.
Perform preventive maintenance and routine inspections on assigned automation, robotics, and control panels.
Troubleshoot assigned out-of-service equipment, correct issues, and mentor lower-level technicians.
Document all work in the computerized maintenance management system (CMMS) and ticketing systems.
Lead root cause analysis of major downtime events and act as a network resource for technical issues.
Develop maintenance personnel knowledge on intermediate to advanced automation, controls, and robotics.
Partner with engineering on commissioning of new controls systems and audit vendor work to provide feedback to leadership on quality of work and SLA performance.
Write and/or modify PMs to standardize across the network and increase effectiveness and perform building project work as assigned.

education_certification.credential: Associate's degree in electronic technology or equivalent preferred.
